text:
Dolce ma equilibrata, alto tenore alcolico ma beverino… Birra fatta molto bene. Note speziate, fruttate dominanti con un finale leggermente da Passito.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orange med tjockt ljusbeigt skum. Doftar sött, lite malt och farinsocker. Smaken fyllig, ganska söt med lite jästsmak. Eftersmaken tämligen torr med lite torkad frukt (aprikos). Påminner om en Saison.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - BBE 02/2019, at Stadin Panimobaari, 20170311) The beer poured deep amber and hazy. Its head was medium sized, white and it lasted long. Aroma had fruitiness, Belgian style yeast, sweetness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, Belgian style yeast, earth, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, yeasty and bitter. A pleasant brew showing yeast flavours.

Shared a 750ml bottle at Pub Italia with Chopz. Pours a fairly large frothy off-white head. Has a cloudy dark orangey appearance with sediments clearly visible. Sticky lacing. Aromas of barley malts, notes of apples. Flavours are a good mix of caramel hints and apple notes. Some bready malt and yeasty notes as well as some dried fruits more in the finish. Medium body. Medium retention.

Shared with PaleAleRider at Pub Italia. Best before date is 04/2108. Couldy caramel colour with yeast floating around. Smooth-looking, light-beige coloured head that is creamish, with nice lacing. Aromas of yeast with caramel and hints of bananas, apples and spices. Smooth mouthfeel with light dryness that builds up with time. Taste of well-blended caramel, yeast, dates, prunes, apples, bready malts and grassy notes. One that gets better and better as it warms up, with lots going on.

750ml bottle. Cloudy, copper-ish red colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Sweet-ish fruity, jelly aroma, notes of red berries, hints of honey, a cereal touch, minimally dusty, yeasty spicy overtones, a floral touch. Taste is dry, minimally dusty yeasty, slightly sweet-ish malty, hints of honey, bread and cereals, a fruity layer delivers cherry and red berries.

Bottle from Systembolaget, shared among friends. Pours cloudy, dark orange/copper with rich, white head. Bready aroma with some dark prunes, hay, yeast. Yeasty taste with dark fruity notes, some toffee, hay. Slightly peppery finish with zest, spices and bread. Nice and a little bit different.
Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a snifter. Slightly orange with small white head. Aroma is fruity, medium body, medium soapy body, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt and some fruit.
Bottle - Candy and fruity sweet yeast. Cloudy copper with a decent white head. Caramel, sweet and some yeasty notes. Light bitterness and dry. Solid as usual.
Pours a cloudy amber colour with a rich off-white head. Aromas of plum and bready malts. Taste of dark fruit and toffee malts. A nice amber biere de garde.

750 ml bottle at Stadin panimobaari, Helsinki. Pours brownish orange with a white head that dissolves quickly. Barnyard-like aroma with sweet malt. The flavour is quite delicious, though, with floral-fruity notes mainly from the yeast, some sweet malt and even a hint of hoppy bitterness. The finish is mostly dominated by the yeast, but a small hint of hops is also present.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl chez Charlotte et Will, appellation Bière de Beloeuil 2014
Couleur ambrée, belle mousse et effervescence moyenne
Nez sur la levure dupont et le caramel
Attaque carmel pointe levurée grillé et le toast pas mal mais pas inoubliable.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Ambrata, bella schiuma ampia e frizzantina. Aroma floreale, lievito e una sottile nota fruttata. Bevuta molto piacevole, carbonazione medio alta, base dolce con una discreta nota erbacea, speziata e funky. Davvero una bella biere de garde.

Cest sans doute la dernière bière de beloeil que je dégustais! Celle-ci sappelant dorénavant Moinette Ambrée. Personnellement, je regretterai son étiquette présentant le château de Beloeil lui donnant un côté désuet salliant très bien avec le côté terroir de cette bière. Visuellement la bière présente une magnifique robe ambrée (légèrement opaque pour ma bouteille), une effervescence intense et une épaisse mousse blanc-cassé. Au nez, sexpriment en priorité les arômes de malt, de caramel, sucre candi. Lutilisation de 5 malts différents donnent à cette bière une riche complexité et des variations des plus intéressantes. La première attaque, très discrète est maltée. Très rapidement arrive une très belle et longue amertume. Les arômes de confiture dabricot, de caramel sur des nuances tourbées et maltées donnent à la bière de beloeil à la fois rondeur et rusticité. Le final, long se termine sur des notes alcooliques et sèches, très caractéristique de la brasserie Dupont, qui comme à son habitude maîtrise parfaitement la puissance de 8,5 % Abv. Essayez là sur un camembert au lait cru, bien affiné...une merveille! PS : si quelquun peu méclairer sur son référencement en tant que bière de garde?

I love dupont, and its very distinct, and easily recognizable yeast flavor (or at least I think its yeast). This one must be my favorite (and i do think Ive tried all their (common) beers): it has all their typical flavours, but then in a more more rounded, full flavour. A really great surprise!

Big foam, but quite short lasting with frothy head. Hazy with little yeast (?) suspended in it. Copper color. Nice, malty aroma with some "cellary" notes. Belgian character is straightforward. Quite citrusy, mellow nose with dominating malt. In the first taste it is fairly dry, then there is a lot of malty sweetness. Everything is nicely contrasted with belgian, little phenolic, spicy character. Carbonation is medium, goes well with mouthfeel. After heating the beer, alcohol becomes noticable, but still very nicely hidden in compare to its real content. Very good biere de garde.

750 ml bottle. Hazy amber-brown body topped off with a fluffy white head. Lemon, funk, cinnamon, banana, bubblegum and flowers on the nose. Slightly sour in the mouth at the start, followed up by a lemon zest hit overlaid with peppery spice. Silky, almost marshmallow like, mouth feel. Zesty finish leads into a spicy aftertaste. Very nice.

750ml bottle from 2014. Not a gusher. 

Pours a semi clear deep gold with plenty of long lasting foam. Serious lacing. 

Spicy fruity malty nose with an apple like presence that suggests dryness. Hmm. .thats an expected quality from the style. 

Fruity again with an almost tart flavour or 2. Malty and spicy and hoppy with the latter bringing a lot of dryness. I like the interaction between the malt and hops. 

Medium body with very lively carbonation. 

I expected something good considering the brewery; I was not disappointed.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a large off white head with good retention and lace. Flowers, honey, dust and hay in the nose. Flavour has honey, dust, light electrical fire, hay, wood. Medium body, lively carbonation, some sweetness, mild bitter and acidc. Ok.
Bloody awesome! Amazing balance, rich malt and ester, belgian bretto taste, preserved fruit, subtle sweet molasses behind the hop/yeast dominance. Cant wait to try again!

750ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Slightly hazy amber color. Huge size, off-white head, stays. Metallic, sweet, yeasty, alcohol in aroma. Sweet, herbal, yeasty, jammy, metallic and alcohol in taste. Metallic, yeasty and sweet in aftertaste. Sweet and alcoholic brew.
Bottle. Pours amber with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, malt, alcohol, fruits, caramel. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, fruits, slight apricots, alcohol. Overall: good.

Bottle shared by Mart. Slightly hazy orange amber beer, off-white head. Nose is slightly buttery, malty, caramel notes, spice. Flavor is caramel and malt, slight pepper, slight esters. Finishes with some mild bitterness and malt. Pretty belgian-y.
On draft at The Sovereign in Georgetownit is a clear golden color with a substantial head. The aroma is funky citrus and the taste is bitter with hints of sweetness
On draft at The Sovereign in Georgetown. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Toffee aroma. Flavors of raisins and herbs. Smooth finish.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, fruit, spices, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque amber/orange beer with heavy yeast and with a medium/large off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with spices, hops and citrus.

Bottle, may 17th 2015. Amber to light body, small white head. Aroma is grassy with faint farmhouse esters, taste is bitter, grassy with a dry palate. Floral finish with mild yeast esters. Not a bad beer!
Bottle from Systembolaget. Yeasty, fruity smell, spicy with dried fruit. Sweet taste with dried fruit and a spicy peppery aroma. Also some light metal. Slightly boozy.
Bottle, 750 from Svijet Piva. Shared with Miro B and JFK10000. Pours dark orange, medium off white head. Malty, caramel, spicy, bit yeasty, lightly warming.

Très frais comme impression en bouche! Pas mal dans le plus raffraichissant quune bière tirant vers le malté puisse être! Cest peut-être moi qui connait mal ce style quest une "bière de garde", mais on dirait ici un mélange entre une Ale belge classique et une allemande facile à boire. Le corps est vivant, raffraichissant, mais en même temps rempli de noisettes et de céréales. Assez impressionant! Très agréable!
Had a wonderful aroma and looks great. Maybe not my favorite tasting but a quality beer.
Mooie caramelkkeur met een goede kraag. Ruikt kruidig, mout, honing. Smaakt zoetig, kruiden, honing.

On tap @Bir&Fud (Rome). Pours golden with a medium and persistent white head. Aroma of belgian yeasts, fruits, spices, grass, nice. Flavour is perfectly balanced, medium malt profile with a good bitter end. Medium body, medium carbonation. Amazing!

February 5, 2016. Bottle, best before July 2016. 
Hazy orange amber with a large slightly off-white head. Aroma is malty and spicy with toffee, bread, pear, almond paste, white pepper and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, light spicy, light bitter and slight warming notes of alcohol. Finish is light bitter with a spicy dry note, white pepper, sweet toffee notes, pear some lemon notes and warming alcohol finish. Medium bodied, average, small bubble, carbonation, slight creamy texture. 
Quite good, there are some notes of glue that makes it feel a bit off in the finish otherwise its quite good.

Cloudy red color, medium off-white head with yeast sediment on tops. Little bit perfumy plus dark fruits, grapes. Medium to heavy sweet, but nicely balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation. //bottle at Craft Room

I didnt like Dupont a lot, because Bon voeux was too spicy and boozy for me. However, this beer turned everything. The Aroma is just amazing. Full of peach, apricot, citrus fruity characters. The taste is sweet and soft. Very well hidden alcohol, awesome stuff.

Une très belle bière à la robe brune, la mousse crémeuse, le nez est puissante, malté et épicé, la bouche est ample, riche, puissante, tout en gardant une très grande buvabilité et qui réalise un accord parfait sur les épices du plat.

Murky copper gold, gentle carbonation, medium head. A: typical Dupont yeast, bit sour, lemon and lime, hay, potato, caramel malts. T: holds middle between Blonde and Speciale Belge. Slightly sour beginning, smooth, followed by the malts, yeasty middle with lime note and gentle boozy touch. Aftertaste is a bit sour, dry, sticky. Not bad.

bread, toast, resin, dough, cloudy, pale, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, 
Ver drinkable, not a character that stands out, holds it own, feels light despite ABV, dominated by malt aromas.
Hazy light brown to orange color with enourmous head. Aroma is yeast and fruits. Flavor is malt, fruits.

Lightly opalescent amber-copper (~18EBC) colour with a large frothy lightly beige head and good lacings. Aromas of barnyard, hay, farmhouse, lightly burnt toffee and autumn leaves develop with a pinch of earthy-herbal notes. Effervescent and rather smooth with a an elegant full body. Herbal, malty yet earthy sweetness builds the backbone but leaves enough room to let some funky yeastyness shine and develops a nicely balanced herbal bitterness. Lasting sweet öight bitter finish. Well developped and maturing is something to look forward to.
Pours gold with wvite head. Aroma is over ripe fruits and glucose. Flavour is fruity, medium bitter and light sweet.

Se da sempre Dupont è stato garanzia di qualità,questa birra non fa altro che confermarlo! Chiara,schiumona alta,spessa e compatta..aroma erbacea,non solo di luppolo ma di veri e propri campi arati..sentori piccanti e lievemente acidula,malto come sfondo..gusto identico,non invadente,pulito e secco nel finale..non si riesce a credere che possa avere 8,5 gradi! Splendida

Cloudy amber with decent rocky head. Strong dried fruit aromas - dried apricot, pear, cherry, along with strong malty notes and some bubblegum. The taste reflects the dried fruits - apricot and cherry particularly, with a caramel and candi sugar malt sweetness too. A firm bitterness in the finish helps balance it. Alcohol is noticeable and, with a bit of rough bitterness, makes this less polished than some of Duponts other offerings. Medium bodied and somewhat acidic. Not bad.

75cl bb08/2015, had a bottle of this once before. - Cloudy beige-amber pour, good organic cap. Odd earthy aroma of orchard fruits fallen and slowly rotting on moist pasture, quince pear and apple on their natural life path toward homemade marmelade - pierced by a good whiff of Belgian jenever alcohol, more than in Moinette. A grassy bitterness overconquers the spéciale belge style dry caramalts at first, bitterhusky cereals and wet grass make for a hard-to-love chicory-root-bitter mix of all essential Belgian soil. Upon pouring over half of the bottle and letting it chambre: both more honey sweetness and more of that peppery, earthy, herbal hop and grain husk bitterness. Among the harsher Duponts brews.

Bottle from Tanakaya shared a tasting. Pours a hazy light brown with a big soapy saison-like head. Dried prune and apricot on the nose with some bread dough and dupont yeast. The fruit really comes out as it warms up. Almost like a fig compote on whole-grain bread. The alcohol is there, but not overly so. Nice fruity and dry finish.
Love it. Nice strong dried fruit aromas, beautiful deep golden brown color. Wonderful balance.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy orange with a large head. 
Sourish and slightly acidic aroma with vinegar and notes of leather. 
Fizzy mouthfeel. 
Leather and blackberries in the flavour. 
Sligtly vinous.

Bottled 750ml. -at Svijet Piva Zagreb. Darker orange/amber coloured, medium sized off-white head, sweetish nose. Moderate malty, caramel, slightly sugary and spicy with notes of fruits and yeast. Noticable alcohol as well. Not bad but Cervesia is better.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours hazy goldenish brown with a huge frothy and fizzy goldenish offwhite head that leaves some sticky lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty, fruity estery and tiny spicy phenolic with white bread, sourdough crackers, marzipan covered baked pears, cinnamon apples, moist hay, moist wood, moist soil, white pepper corns, lemon zest and hints of glue. Taste is sweet, fruity estery and tiny spicy phenolic. Mouthfeel is soft, round and medium bodied. Finish is sweet with caramel, dark bread, baked pears, apricots, moist hay, moist soil, white pepper corns and lemon peal. Drinkable but not really my cup if tea atm.

Bottle split in the garden, thanks to James, 25/06/15.
Clear orange amber with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is bread dough, citric rinds, straw, light yeast. 
Taste comprises earthy tones, bitter orange, light spice, hay, wooded notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. 
Solid for the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bouteille de 75cl. Couleur ambrée, trouble, belle mousse de tenue correcte. Arômes de céréales, pointe de réglisse, houblon bien présent. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert

Otwarcie korka kończy się pokaźnym strzałem jak przy szampanie, piwo delikatnie podnosi się ku górze, ale nie wylatuje z butelki. Po przelaniu do sniftera tworzy się spora, drobna, kremowa piana, dość trwała i tworząca nieśmiały lajsing, barwa jasno bursztynowa, pomarańczowa, mętna - wewnątrz pływają drobinki chmielowo-drożdżowe. Aromat jasnych winogron, brzoskwiń, trawy cytrynowej, białego wina i delikatnej stajni - pięknie jest to skomponowane i dość intensywne. W smaku jest fantastycznie orzeźwiająco, delikatna winogronowa słodycz przeplata się z muśnięciem pomarańczowej kwaskowatości, nuty półwytrawnego wina łączą się z belgijskimi przyprawami, goryczka bardzo subtelna, ziołowo-alkoholowa. Nagazowanie drobne, musujące, średniej intensywności i takie samo odczucie pełni w ustach, w afterteasie natomiast lekka taniniczność, szorstkość starego drewna na języku, alkohol świetnie domyka całości niepozornym ciepłem w gardle. 
Taka interpretacja Biere de Garde to ja rozumiem - absolutnie nie jest to nudne piwo. Począwszy od robiącego pozytywne wrażenie opakowania, poprzez fantastyczny aromat, na orzeźwiająco-deserowym smaku kończąc La Biere de Beloeil wypada pozytywnie. Francuski ugrzeczniony styl dostaje tu zdecydowanie szampańskich bąbelek i nieco dzikości, co dostarcza nam nie lada atrakcji sensoryczno-degustatorskich...

750 ml corked and caged bottle. Pours a translucent orange brown color with a massive rocky beige head. Aroma is yeasty, fruity malt with a touch of sweet cherries. Earthy sweet malt flavor has a a slight bready note. Some dried fruit and toasted malt as well. Smooth and drinkable with a soft malty palate. Finishes dry with grassy hops.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av jäst, gräs, örter, malt, säd och brödkryddor som fänkål och pomerans. Lagom sötma, lätt kropp, en aning disig och slö i smakerna. Gott!

Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad och ganska disig. En rustik bière de Garde med belgisk karaktär från jästen och en bra gräsig beska som balanserar de ganska söta maltsmakerna. För det är malten i fokus, massor av sädiga brödsmaker, men lite brödkryddor som fänkål, en gnutta anis och lite pomerans. Trevlig.
On tap at Delirium Village in Brussels. Very mild and modest aroma and taste. A bit cloudy amber appearance.
Amber with small white head. Nice strong bitterness, some sweet fruity notes. Strong bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour. Grassy aroma of dry yeast and aroma hop. Taste is quite bitter and dry, with grass, caramel and grain. Solid.

Opaque red copper-coloured beer with waves of yeast floating around, propelled by lots of bubbles.
Sweet cherry smell with subtle sourness. Salty wood, white pepper, peachy.
Taste is surprisingly sweet, with alcohol bitterness. Complex, going from wood to almost stout-like and back to bitter flowers saison. Nuts, even some cheese. The alcohol is not very nice but gets better, developing into something like chocolate. Fusion between saison and Belgian blond.

Aroma of champagne and kriek. Lots of sweet grapes and peaches. Nice dark yellow, with tiny yeasty parts sticked to the glass. Nice foamy white head. A bit dry and very alcoholic. White wine (grapes), silty, a bit of caramel and vanilla. Great in potential, but the alcoholic flavour is a shame. Dry yeasty aftertaste.

Bottle purchased at Total Wine & Spirits. Poured into Belgian glass and consumed with commonshawn and rosskyle. Plenty of sediment. Aroma has some floral and bitter characteristics. Color has a cloudy, murky golden orange nature. Taste is complex. Spices are prevalent with caramel and malt coming through in the middle and end. Slight sour and funk to this one. Very interesting and unique.

Big bottle with commonmac and rosskyle. Cloudy pale orange with bubbly white head. Woody and wild fruit aroma. Clean taste with some grassy fruit and floral candy . Finish is funky and some whiskey elements. Unique and interesting, a lot going on here.

Out of a bottle. Red copper color with medium white head. Sweet grainy aroma. Medium body with carbonation. Sweet plum flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Couleur du caramel foncé avec un grand col beige. Larôme du levure belge avec un peu de fruits séchées. Le goût est pareil, un peu sucré dabord avec une finition sec.

Cloudy orange amber thin foamy Lacy wbeige head; aroma is mildly malty slight funk; Flava is robust sweet malty fruity with bubble gum notes and dry graininess; feels medium moderate fizz; finishes dry with tangy yeasty notes and he notes s of bannana

bottled, aged 2 years. quite a murky shade of orange with a minimal head and a few little floaties; aroma of raisins, earthy spice; light sourness - salt and vinegar crisps, cloves, sultanas, wooden floorboards

Pullo @ Systembolaget. Kaatuu tuppaanilasiin oranssihtavan kultaisena ja sameana, muhkean kolmen sormen paksuisen pumpulisen vaahdon suojaamana. Tuoksussa vahvimpana on saisonmainen belgihiivainen mausteisuus, karviaismarja ja marjapensas, mutta ko. tyylistä tämän erottaa tuhdin, leipäisen mallasrungon vuoksi. Kovin happaman sitruksisen tuntuinen yleisvaikutelma jäi tuoksusta. Maku on niin ikään hyvin happaman sitruunainen, mutta siinä on myös vahvana mausteinen belgihiiva ja loppumaussa leipäinen maltaisuus. Karviaismarjaa ja maamaisuutta on, mutta kuriositeettina. Suutuntuma on hyvin hapan, hiilihappoinen ja suht tuhdisti humaloitu. Hieno saison/vahva belgiale/ biere de garde, jossa belgihiiva näyttää parhaita puoliaan. Tällaisen belgientusiastin täydellinen iltapala.

Bottle from MOMH. Dark brown with a slightly red tinge, opaque, slightly beige head. Aroma is slightly hot, phenolic banana, cheesy, woody and a little sweet, along with some baked sweet bread. Medium to high carbonation. Sweet, like speculoos biscuits, some mixed spice, a little raisin. Slight acidic twang in the finish. Disappointing.

Colore ambrato/arancione. Odore molto fruttato, dolce, albicocca, alcool.
Corposa, molto frizzante, dolce e fruttata ma non stucchevole. Dopo qualche sorso lalcool risulta più evidente.

750ml bottle. Light brown body with a huge white head. Caramel, grain, spices and alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vanuxeem, Ploegsteert - BE. Color: dark amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: roasted malt and caramel. Notes of bread. Taste: nice caramel taste and brown sugar. Aftertaste: good caramel finish.
Smakrik och ganska fruktig. En ton av knäck. Utmärkt till sällskap eller till en pastarätt.

75cl 2014 vintage bottle @ home.
App: Hazy orange brown, lumps at the bottom, big soapy bubbly pale beige head.
Aroma: sweet fruity yeasty spicy. Marzipan, candied fruitiness prunes pear apples, white pepper some leather/tobacco and gluey alcohol.
Taste: initial sweetness with fruits and hints of caramel followed by a dry peppery alkoholic finish. Apple oranges figs grapes, tobacco and pepper. Too much alcohol.
Palate: big and sharp bubbles, oily, dry woody finish.
Overall: Too much alcohol and peppery spice for me. Felt like someone splashed Vodka in my glass. First real disappointment from Dupont.

Pours deep orange with a small white head. Aroma of wheat and grain with some deep alchohol. light belgian barnyard yeast. Taste is sweet grain and a slight alchohol bite. A touch of fruitiness. Finishes slightly dry.

Bottle. 
Pours unclear dark blonde. Big white head. 
Smell is saison maltyness, bit buttery, rather sweet ( compared to a saison) . Taste is full grainyness. Bitter back. Buttery ( dyacethyl) . Rather high carbo. Nice mouthfeel. Ok beer
Bottle at Craigs. Pours copper amber, nose is caramel, yeasty, taste is fizzy, juicy fruit.

750ml bottle. Hazy mahogany with a frothy off-white head. Flavors are fresh dough, honey, caramel, dried fruits and alcohol with herbal and spicy notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, oily texture. Harsh.
Beer tasting @ Havregatan 6/12-14. Aroma: Yeasty, light spicy and fruity. Taste: Dito + light caramel.
@ Beer tasting, Havregatan 141206. Fruity and yeasty, spicy and caramely, dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Bottle (750 ml). 2014 cork. Split 3-ways.

Appearance: Murky amber/brown with a medium quickly diminishing off-white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Quite spicy with caramel malt, earthy notes and light fruitiness.

Taste: Spices, caramel malt, light fruitiness, acidiy notes and not much else.

Palate: Medium body. Prickly carbonation. Watery mouthfeel. Spicy finish. 

Overall: Quite disappointing from Dupont. Reading some other ratings, this beer seems to change a lot yearly. This one clearly lack of depth as theres not much else behind the spiciness. The aroma and taste arent that bad, but the body is really weak and theres no Dupont nice usual rustic features either.

Color of dried apricots, very hazy. Yellow-dust-colored, medium-fine, uniform head which fades to film at a moderate-to-quick rate. Aroma is a sweet nectar, neutral, light caramel, sweet hay, apple pie, hint of granny smith underneath the sweetness. Little light brown sugar. Medium body, watery but slightly syrupy. Soft, medium coarseness in the carbonation. Flavor is light, clean demerara sweetness with an herbal, delicate bitterness to balance throughout the taste. Fades quietly. Some sweet pear. Very nice, yummy biere de garde. I love the bitterness balance in the flavor.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma is sour and has a bit of bread and some fruit. Pours light brown with a rich white head. Taste is complex, a mix of malts, caramel, fruits and a hint of nuts. Palate is fittingly thin and very drinkable. Overall a good beer with a complexity.

Pours a darkish amber with a fizzy offwhite head. Nose is a little banana, raisin, clove, brown sugar, a slight damp funk. Flavor is dark fruit, plum, raisin, banana, slightly sharp on the mid palate, lots of clove on the finish, with a little brandy and some candi sugar. Medium body with a fizzy carbonation. Not bad.

bread, hay, grass, herbs, minerals and alcohol. Golden/ amber colour, medium white head. Light bite, mid-sweet, ABV well integrated. 
Medium body, soft finish.
Ok.

Espuma de boa formação e persistência. Cor laranja escuro. Aroma de frutas amarelas e caramelo ao fundo. No sabor, pêssegos, malte, com médio e persistente amargor e médio dulçor. Muito boa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Pours a hazy light borwn color with a huge head. Sweet and malty aroma with lots of fruits. Apples and pear, apricots and lemon. Bread, grain, dust, dough, candy, a hint of alcohol and some toffee & pepper also constitutes the aroma. Medium bodied, smooth but lightly astringent mouth feel.Taste of pear, apples, bread, pepper, apricots, dough. Mid-taste has orange and more pepper plus bread & candy. Drier finish with dusty notes, more pear, apple peel and a moderate nutty bitterness. Nice complexity, but a bit too sprawling. Will probably mellow out with some aging.

750mL bottle, pours a dark rusted amber brown with a medium beige head. Nose brings out toasted chestnuts, farmhouse notes, toasted oak and bready malt. Flavour reveals dry nutty notes upfront, with toasted crusty rye bread, oak and farmhouse yeast. Quite complex, with many deep layers. Robust and flavourful. ABV is extremely well-masked. Excellent.

2011 750mL bottle drunk February 2014Amber colored body with some light bronze notes and a very large, white Dupont head that is endlessly retained.Vanilla, light caramel and black pepper in the nose. Some oxidation noted, though its not cardboard-like, just adds more vanilla and mixing with the special B (I think?), it adds a sweet sherry tone. Interesting. The ultra dry, plasticy esters dont really work as well here as they do with the dry, spicy hops and honey pils malt of their pale beers.Sweet caramel and vanilla and a bit of bittersweet raisin and some acidity wash over the palate. Hop bitterness and black pepper phenols do dry the palate somewhat, but its still quite malty and somewhat "thick". As with the 2011 Monks stout I just had, Im guessing this hasnt aged wonderfully. Probably needs all the hop flavor and bitterness it can get to balance out this rich maltiness. Still, nothing to scoff at and has some interesting things going on with the yeast and malt interplay.

Bière de château dont la recette date déjà de 25 ans, mais avec toute lexpérience et le 
savoir-faire de cette brasserie Dupont. On est admiratif des recettes de cette brasserie...
Bouteille de 75 cl, bouchonnée de liège, à létiquette sobre (même si cest un produit de château,
et quel château ), confirmant ainsi que cette brasserie sattache beaucoup plus à ses bières
quau marketing détiquette, mais on le savait parfaitement.... 
Niveau dalcool abv : 8,5 %.
Couleur roux moyen superbe. Clarté pure, clean. Bulles moyennes par milliers, présentes dans
le moindre mm du verre. (déjà lexplosion à louverture était très belle, mais on en a la 
confirmation visuelle dans son verre...)
Mousse beige claire à cratères magnifiques du type trappiste....
Arômes de lie de vin, prune, poire, malts divers (il y en a 5!!!!) dont le caramel, candi, cassonade,
amandes.
1ère bouche à la très belle prise veloutée sur des épices fortes, de la muscade, du poivre et de la
girofle. Arrière-bouche maltée et un peu tourbée, à lamertume soutenue.
2ème nez de miel de châtaigne.
2ème bouche assez vineuse, mais à la très grande arrière-bouche maltée.
3ème nez tourbé.
3ème bouche pleine, complète, dans le style pain complet et fruits très mûrs.
Arrière-bouche du type dune brune extra-forte.
Longueur à la densité énorme et à la grande ampleur. Arrière-bouches remarquables.
Levure dense, forte, prenante, qui a tout dune grande.
Alcool magnifique, à la progression linéaire, constante : un soutien parfait au goût.
Finale immense. Un sommet brassicole : malt/fruit/bois/levure.
Conclusion : à défaut dabbaye réelle de la moinette (ce qui est dommage, mais un fait 
historique même sil y a eu une cense et un moulin ...), cette bière fera parfaitement office de bière de château. Pour lanecdote, le sceau « abbaye de la moinette » figure encore au bas de létiquette,
comme les bières ont pu sappeler au départ  mais ce nest plus quune nostalgie...
Ceci dit, « bière de château » est très bien aussi !!! (cfr par exemple la Kasteel  qui en est 
bien fière...). La recette de 1988 est parfaite pour une bière de château, elle est très noble,
avec lemploi de 5 malts et un superbe équilibre général.
Petite suggestion personnelle : dans lesprit dune dégustation Dupont au sommet, pour obtenir
un résultat certain, je propose de remplacer
la moinette brune par cette bière de Beloeil, de façon à avoir un ensemble blonde et brune
avec une cote maximale  (et il y a dailleurs dautres choix pour la note maxi  quelle
brasserie merveilleuse!!!).

Taste: surprisingly hoppy and herbal at first sip, some slightly boozy caramel malts crest nicely to balance into some sweetness complemented by the slightly funky yeast. A soft pour into my teku glass produces a three finger thick, nice tan colored head. The beer is a bright amber color that shows a brilliantly clear, gold tinged, light amber hue when held up to the light. The aroma is a mix of sweet grain, earthy spice notes, complementary fruit character, a nice yeasty mustiness, and a touch of hop character. Specifically the nose reminds me of soft, citrus zest, and earthy, musty spice character and musty hay like grain note, as well as an earthy whole grain cracker like aroma, and perhaps even a touch of dried weed like notes as well as a spicy floral character is noticeable. The nose is quite complex and interesting, definitely a beer that I can enjoy smelling for quite some time.
 
Quite effervescent and even foamy as it first hits my tongue, this plays up a spiciness due to the peppery carbonic bite. The beer is fairly light bodied, though does have some viscosity to it that is noticeable under the bubbly effervescence. The beer has a spiciness to it that is peppery, a bit floral, is phenolic, though not overly clove like, definitely earthy, and a bit musty. The malt character is a touch grassy, definitely has a whole grain cracker character to it, and perhaps a chewy bread like note at times. The yeast character in this is quite prominent, though it does not come through quite as brightly as it does in the paler malt focused Saison.
 
Not bad, well truly it is quite good, though I am perhaps a touch more critical because this beer is from Dupont. Still this has quite the complexity, and is deep and sort of rich in a way that keeps this light and quaffable beyond what a beer of this strength should be.

Bottle at Stout 3 & Freestyle Tasting, thanks to Leighton. It pours hazy amber with a thick off-white head. The nose is earth,dough, candy,icing sugar and sponge cake. The taste is sponge cake, earth, citrus, metallic, honey, cake, bread and some alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and high carbonation. Interesting and well-balanced. Pretty nice.

Bottle at the Stouts Pt. III & Others Tasting - London. From Dranken Geers. Pours clear, deep and bright gold with a strong, creamy head. Lots of bread and cereal in the nose, hints of hay and sugar. Big sweet flavor, plenty of lightly toasted bread, hints of honey, mellow orange. Medium to full. Bodied with average carbonation. Moderate warmth to finish, lots of bready malts, a bit more honey, white bread, mellow hay bitterness. Nice stuff.
On tap at Maxs in Baltimore during Belgianfest 2013. Earthy and musky, but in the right way. Dries fruit, brown sugar and a slightly sour finish.

75 cl. traditional green bottle @ home. Porchused from Willems. Very loud pop when opening but no gusher. Cork says 2011 on it  so 2011 Vintage? Pours a cloudy / murky heavily brown amber with a very creamy white head. Smell is incredible, wonderfully EU hoppy, sweet tangerine, biscuit, delicious caramel and sticky toffee, dried orange peel, flowers, reminds me a bit of the finest fresh Orval bottles I have had. Taste is sweet caramel, dried orange peel, tangerines, light floral, EU hoppy, brown sugar, sticky toffee, alcoholic flourishes, light grass, very fruity, nectar, nectarines, boozy. Full, perfect carb. Incredible, one of the best I have had so far. Wonder if this beer is always this excellent or I just got lucky because some of the bottles of regular saison I have had, have been one of the finest beers ever, like ever and others were just infected or not as good etc. At this price, I may need to investigate further because this is stellar.

On tap at Toronado. Aroma is rich and malt with a lot of dark fruit notes, vinous with plum and Concord grape juice. Candy-like. Dark golden amber clear with thin lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts malty and slightly sweet. Dark fruit sweetness with mild orange notes and grape juice. Finish is light bitter with good sweet notes and nutty bitterness. Tasty.
Dark orange pour with a thin white head. Aroma is earthy, musty, old berries and cellar. Slight fruit notes. Mildew?  Flavor is murky, more cellar, musty. Interesting but not my favorite.
Bottle. Pours musky amber brown with bone white head. Nice lacing. Nose and taste of musky berry fruit, yeast, earthy malt, caramel, brown sugar and dark breads. Medium body.
750 mL bottle.  Cloudy brown pour with a thick off white frothy head.  Medium body with hints of caramel, brown sugar, yeast/bread with some nice spices in the finish.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2012 750ml bottle split with Anndiesel.  Unfiltered golden-orange body, Fluffy, thick, creamy white head.  Pretty much nails it, this is a great beer.  Big, but not unpleasant malt backbone with a pronounced dry,lemony hop balance.  A little stronger than I associate Bierre De Garde,  Sweet too, with a touch of honey.  Biting up front, rich and lusciously sweet finish.  Lots of depth, yet it all comes together quite concisely, this is really a solid offering.  Some sour wheat/straw tones, reminiscent of Orval in a sense, but bigger, maltier.  Mellow brown chocolate notes come out when the bottom of the bottle has been poured..Id guess this would be a hard beer to gauge and appreciate with a 2oz sample.

Pour is a rustic amber copper with a large bubbly off white head and a moderate lacing.  The nose has a fair bit of yeast and peppery spice, dusty farmhouse notes with a lemon twang and lightly toasted biscuit to balance.  Taste has less yeast to it, still nice and spicy in back lingering through the finish with toasted grains and lightly doughy malt body with a faint citrus hop in behind.  Medium body with a creamy palate and assertive dry finish. Drinks more like a saison.
Draft at blue monk, copper pour. Fruity forward flavor, Light bubblegum, medium maltiness. Active mouthfeel, good beer

Bottle, light brownish amber with a two finger, big-bubbled beige head. Nose is grassy, caramely, herbal, and slightly mushroom-y. Tastes a bit sweeter upon the first sip, but the nuanced flavors come out in subsequent sips. Prickly palate. Reminds me of some of the Fantome saisons in its weirdness. I dig it.

Bottle shared from Deanso.  Pours hazy amber with a medium off white head.  Aroma of fruit, toffee, caramel and nuts.  Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter.  Medium bodied with soft to moderate carbonation.

75cl bottle leaving present from work shared with Kermis et al.
Cork exploded out of the bottle.  Thick white head.  Hazy amber pour.  Lovely beer!

March 9, 2012 - with blankboy, gregclow, jercraigs & mabel.  750ml green corked & caged bottle c/o blankboy.  Cloudy amber-gold with a smallish diminishing fizzy/creamy white head.  Aroma and taste are very fruity - ripe peach, plenty of yeast,  spicy, and definitely some alcohol in the mix - simple but well done, very tasty strong Belgian.  Solid body, average carbonation, slightly boozy finish, just very very nice from start to finish.

Bottle (75 cl) from beerplanet.be. Clear/shady amber, large off-white head.  Medium bodied, high carbonation. Slightly caramelly and nutty, a bit restrained Dupont house character. Dry with medium bitterness.
Colore ambrato, schiuma compatta e cremosa. Il malto prevale in tutto e per tutto, dallolfatto al palato. Le varianti vanno dal malto caramellato a quello leggermente tostato.

[SCHIUMA]			
color crema, abbondante , media finezza e persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
buona intesità,  profumi di lieviti belga in primo piano, sentori di pane, e frutta matura, un tocco alcolico di fondo			
[GUSTO]			
inizia dolce, con un buon contributo dei malti, in bocca non regala note particolarmente fruttate passando direttamente ad un finale  amaro, con note terrose e poi erbali. Un leggero speziato alcolico fa capolino, lasciando la bocca un po alappata.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, consistente ma morbida in bocca, buona carbonazione , alcohol presente ma ben inserito			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
buon prodotto con sfumature interessanti, più promettenti al naso che in bocca. Lascia un po perplessi nel finale nel quale perde forse una certa armonicità, lasciando un retrogusto slegato. Buona bevibilità nonostante l8% abbondante.

On draught at City Beer. Aroma of sweet malt and esters. A little banana. Deep slightly hazy orange with a quickly disappearing white head. Remains on collar with slight lacing. Chewy and well carbonated. Spritzy effervescence. Some fruit and slight spicy finish and bitterness. Spicy hop flavo.

On tap. Clear reddish golden with a fizzy white head. Caramel green apple and wet dog aroma. Light barn yard funk green apple and caramel taste with a sweet must finish and a medium bodied silky palate.
On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY.  Poured a much darker red than I was expecting.  Good, some sweet fruits but not overly sweet.  I enjoyed this one, spicy but not over the top.
Amber colored with a finger of off white head. Shy nose with some nutty aromatics. Highly carbonated with honeydew melon and almond on the palate. The finish is a bit clipped.

Bottle from Big Star.

Copper pour, long-lived head. What a nose! Metallic Dupont delight distilled. Yes, there is some stewed vegetable in there, which drops this shy of shy of a 10 on first encounter (as I finish the bottle, the aroma drops another point or two with sweet spices coming on too strong). Alcohol is relatively subdued when cold -- Id have called it at about 7% based on my first sips--though as it warms one can pick it up and were in Avec territory.  Full of meaty, savory flavors relative to the other Dupont offerings. On the negative side, it comes off too sweet for my taste (grilled summer corn), especially as I move into the second half of the bottle. I like it, but didnt need 25 oz of it. A good beer, but not a thing of transcendent brilliance like Vieille Provision, Avril, or even Avec. 

Still, Im pleased this is now distributed to Washington state.

Bottle, 75cl corked, at RBNAG-11. An unclear, golden-orange beer topped by a small, off-white head. Fruity and grainy nose with some berries. Some cooked cabbage as well, in a strange, nice way. The aroma has a faint roasted or nutty touch, with biscuits, fruityness and grains. Full-bodied, nicely carbonated. Some bitterness in the else caramel-ish and biscuity finish. A nice but unusual beer. 111015

Head: much off-white colored foam. Color: amber. Aroma: fruit. Taste: sweet bitter, mild. Palate: dry, lots of CO2, long lasting. Overall: very nice.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Amber coloured with a big golden fluffy head. Aroma is lots of yeast, bit of honey and sweetness, slight funk, bready malt. Taste is very Belgian, wheaty, yeasty, some herbal elements, slight citrus at finish. Full on boozy bodied. Very nice.

Currently drinking while typing. Damn this is one amazing beer, it certainly is right up my street! After I popped the cork and poured this beauty into a tulip glass I admired the malty caramel aroma for a while and then remembered what I was doing. There are mountains of sweet sugary caramels from the Beloeil malt blend that are surrounded with Belgian yeasts, dough, grassy hops and nuttiness. It appears as a beautiful vessel of amber goodness with an off white/beige/light brown head that sustains throughout! Amazing sweet, brown bread flavours from the blend of 5 malts, mellow hops, Belgian yeast flavours with a sustained finish of malts and hops. Incredibly smooth yet full feel with a suitable carbonation. This is among one of the best beers I have tried this year, it has such an amazing blend of everything! Every ingredient of this beer blends perfectly with every other one, Im over the moon with this one!

Similar to a saison, but a little bigger, a little sweeter.  Still has that distinctive chalkiness from dupont beers, good yeasty quality.  I dont know many biere de garde that Ive had, but this was pretty solid.
bottle at home ... copper ... thin white head ... soft sweet candi suger floral nose ... over fizzy ... juicy fruits ... sweet malts ... oily fruits ... not getting the alcohol...
Bottle. Thanks Benjii. Amber orange with big white head. Aroma is a little weak, caramel, light spiciness, peppery, Belgian yeast. Taste has peppery spicy yeast, caramel. Quite clean, not bad
Gedronken bij benzai samen met dutchdrebus. Bruin met veel zooi. Ruikt naar afwasmiddel, drop en wijn. Smaakt zoet en naar wijn
Draught from blind tiger.  Pours a dark red to orange. Some fruits and yeasty flavors. Pretty good

75cl bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Slightly unclear dark orange color with lots of small yeast paticles in it, big off-white head that lasts quite a while. Smell malts, soap, slightly hops and herbs. Taste malts, lightly sweet and a herbal finish. Bit winey as well. Medium body, low to medium carbo.
Bottle @ benzai. Hazy orange colour with lots of particles. Smells malty, hay, honey and some wine/cork. Tastes wine, cork, wood, hay, malts, herbs, soapy and grains. Too much carbo, medium body.

At just on cool. Cork bursts off with a cloud of CO2 following. Pours light. A dull, deep, orange chestnut in colour and opaque from the proteins in suspension. Big Belgian head is sadly diminishing leaving but a ring of white. Nutty praline and sulphury burst up first; warming, oddly buttery with hints of dodgy candied nuts. Second whiff a minute later has supple, ripe fruit like doughy cantaloupe and honeydew, peach and lychee all hinting at the yeast used. There is also a hint of Belgian pale candi, nutmeg and mace spice and a touch of oaken wood. Odd hint of camphor and eucalypt kick it off as different on first sip. Nice level of sweetness, candyish, upfront. A wheatlike, drying and gritty toasted malt mid-palate and finish where it seems to drop off without a trace. Medium light body and sprightly in carbonation, it has a good overall mouthfeel. Very nutty, earthy, yeasty and musty in the tail with a piercing vanillin note. As it warms the palate shifts towards the nutty praline with an ever building taste of pale wood and absorbing yeast undertones. I expected more fruit esters but this was actually a killer Biere de Garde. Would love to try it again as I got caught up just drinking to truly absorb it. Nice  (Corked 75cL, BBE 01/14, Mane Liquor, Belmont)

Draft. Pour is hazy copper/amber with a yellow head, good retention/some lace. Aroma is slightly tart, earth, fruity esters, grain. Taste is quite malty, dry, earth, bread, fruity yeast, light booze. Palate is dry, soft, creamy, with a sweet finish. Good.
Courtesy of BDR.  Dark copper color with a large but quickly falling head.  Strong floarl and earthy aroma.  Quite herbal, grassy and earthy.  Somewhat yeasty.
This beer tasted slightly tart and sweet, this turned to quite an acidic taste on the palate
Hazy blond with big foamy head. Light hop in the aroma, some yeast too. Flavour also has some spicy yeast and light citrus. A little sharp, tart and also slightly soapy.

Light beige creamy head. Cloudy amber colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (peach, cherry) and light caramel and wooden notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (peach, ripe apricot and berries) and vanilla tones, ending in a moderately malty and fruity finish. Medium to full bodied.

S: hazy brown-orange, light collar, medium bubbles, light lacing

A: spicy, slightly sweet, sticky, malty

T: balanced strength, a bit of spice, a bit of malt, medium finish

O: solid, different for a saison, richer & thicker than other saisons, but good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy copper with a fluffy, persistent dense head.  Aroma is banana, clove, raisin, biscuit, somewhat faint.  Taste is banana bread, clove, coriander, orange peel, raisin, some abv.  Body is medium, creamy, frothy, long complex finish.  Overall, a unique brew that is highly delicious.  Didnt even know it was a biere de garde until I decided to log the rating.

[4324-20120309] 750mL bottle. Mild floral caramel malt aroma ha a hint of chocolate or cocoa dust. Hazy, dark orange amber body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Malty orange grainy flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/4/7/3+/15) 3.6
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jerc)
750ml bottle.  Chestnut amber pour, with a rocky off white head.  Biscuit, yeasty, fruit, moderately sweet, dusty, apple, and light hay.  A nice biere de garde, which is not suprising from dupont.

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp. March 9. Pours a murky orange-amber with lots of tiny bubbles and a small creamy white head. Good lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast, a good amount of herbs and spices, caramel malt, fruit, light grassy hops and some perfumy notes. Flavour is yeasty and fruit along with herbs and light hops. Medium bodied. Lovely stuff.

Bottle. Cloudy amber body with a big, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is musty with notes of floral hops, toasted grain, sweet citrus, peach. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter, a bitterness that lingers long into the dry finish. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Taste of tart lemon in the background. The balance among the hop bitterness and lemon citrus is nicely done.

Whole Foods, P st, DC 750ml ($12): Pours a chestnut colour with a prodigious white head. Aroma is a little skunky at first (green bottle?), but then the sugar and that delightful Dupont yeast starts to shine. Taste is very dry. Lots of interesting and weird notes that I cant quite place. Hops and a small amount of bitterness are present too. Alcohol is well covered and the lightness of the body is still maintained. This tastes way better than most Biere de Gardes, a style I find to be consistently underwhelming. Pretty dank, yeah.
Bottle. Pale amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is fruit, malt, spices. Flavour is fruit, malt, spices, yeast, citrus. Nice beer.

2012-03-09. Hazy orange body, nice foamy white head. 3+ Modest aroma, light pale malt, light spice character. 6+ Flavour is similar, pale malt core, kiss of honey, very mild spice. 7+ Average bodied palate. Less assertive than some, but a very enjoyable take on a saison. Bottle shared by Blankboy"I like your beeps!" - Mabel

Il malto tiranneggia sul sapore di questa birra, lasciando un pò di spazio ai sapori fruttati e caramellati per finire nel aroma del luppolo che rende il finale persistente. Brasserie Dupont; un nome una garanzia.

pours a clear amber hue with a small white head
aroma is astringent and malty
flavor is a little astringent at the beginning with a small hoppy end with some alcohol notes
light mouthfeel with lively carbonation
Bottle. Huge light tan head with a hazy orange amber body. Aroma-taste: toffee apple, floral, biscuit, spicey with a significant background citrusy bitterness. Medium bodied, high carbonation.
Draft.  Hazy amber body, small off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, herbal, light bread.  Taste is medium sweet, bread/caramel, herbal.  Medium body, some stickiness.

Bottle: 2010:
Big airy and slow disappearing off white head on top of an almost clear orange colored beer.
Smell yeasty fruits like peach, light apricot, metallic, malts and some herbs.
Taste yeasty fruits, peach, creamy, some barley malts and hops that tend to go bit nasty, still and luckily they dont reach it. Pretty good for a Biere de Garde.
Bitter malty fruit aftertaste
Low to medium carbo, soft light tingly mouthfeel, medium body and a texture between watery and creamy.
One of the better Biere de Gardes I have tasted!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Overripe orange and triple sec aroma. Hazy amber, thin head. Overripe orange, but not overly fruity. Hay present. Very subtle farmhouse notes.
75cl. Bottle. Thanks to Chrisv10. Pours cloudy orange with a creamy head and lacings. Citrus, yeast and grain. Lively carbonation. Hints of dark fruit and caramel. Medium bodied.

Duponts version of a pale Belgian tripel offers a damp bitter nose which lacks a little of the sugar you typically smell in abbey tripels. The flavour is refreshing and bitter. As good as, or better than, the famous saison. A good, non-pretentious beer (youll have to look real hard to find the word "dupont" on the label).

750 c&c from The Davis Beer Shoppe in Davis, CA. Cork hit the ceiling! Pours hazy orange copper with a creamy beige head. Aromas of earth, yeast/spice and light citrus. Mayhap a touch of fruits de bois. Full bodied. Flavor is fruit, earth and just a little spice. Perhaps a touch of honey/perhaps not. Its really good. Finishes dry and fruitily earthy.

750ml bottle. A well packed beige head of foam sits evenly above a deep amber to orange beer. The foam settles to leave a flat even layer. Strong almost port like aromas come through at first, followed by a fruity spiciness. In the mouth this beer is quite lively and full and again there is a strong alcohol port like flavour. A coating is left on the side of the glass and the flavour remains in the mouth long after the beer has gone. This is a beer to be sipped and savoured and would match well with a really strong soft cheese.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2011 75cl bottle. Hazy orange with a small white head. Nose : bread and caramel malts. Small raisins, banana and apricot. Sip :  a bit sweet and  dried fruit sour. Small fruit esters a long the way.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 Amber.  Cloudy with a big head.  The aroma is yeasty with some plasticy phenols and slight pear notes.  Quite yeasty, with light malt, some dark fruits like plums.  Yeasty finish.  Somewhere between Moinette and Saison Dupont, but note with the best attributes of those beers.  Decent beer, but I prefer others from this brewery.

Bottle. Luminescent, hazed burnt orange-chestnut. Airy, loose, but stable beige head. Caramelized malt, custard, butter creme malty aroma. High residual sugars. Lively carbonation. Alcohol drying the finish a little. Has a Bier de table feel, but its strong. Goes well with food.

Shared bottle @RBNAG-11. A low off-white head over an unclear orangey golden body. Light nutty malts up front. Then a yeast note and whiff of fruit-juice, like the syrup from canned fruits. Taste is light acidic-fruity with spice and bitter tones. Restrained malt body. Medium full. Slick in the mouth. Clean and dry ending.

Fruity almost wine like aroma from a cloudy amber pour. The head was huge and long lasting lacing the glass all the way to the bottom. Despite the fruity aroma, the beer is not at all sweet. Just a bit of sugar on the tip of the tongue quickly washed away by a peppery bitterness. The finish is extremely dry and refreshing.
caramel, floral, licorice, vanilla, orange, cloudy, rocky head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, Belgian yeast, grain, slight pepper, slight spice, and a hint of funk.  Poured orange in color with a large, creamy, dense, tan head that diminished a bit but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, Belgian yeast, yeast, slight spices, slight pepper, and more yeast.  Very yeasty.  Medium body.  Lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, Belgian yeast, yeast finish is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  8.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, yeast, spice and fruit.
15.10.2011. 0,75l Bottle. Brown colour with off-whita head. Aroma is sweet with malt. Moderate bitterness and nice bitter aftertaste.

Draft. Rich amber beer with a dark cream colored head. Malt and light caramel aroma with earth and yeast. Yeast and caramel flavor with spice and earth. Medium bodied. Caramel and yeast lingers with spice and light earthiness.

Hazy blond amber beer, white head. Aroma of hay, sweet malts, English biscuits, fine yeast, some citrus, light silage. Somewhat reminding of the smell of a cigar box. Flavour malty sweet, ever so slightly tart, light bitter. Quite spicy and fruity apricots. Finish dry with lingering bitterness and fruity tones. Nice one.
(From 75cL bottle @ home)

Thanks to GT2 for this bottle. Cloudy amber pour with a decently sized white head. Nose and flavor both hold interesting lemon wheat presence, rye dough, carraway seed, and a touch of toasted sesame. Really a beautiful balance on the palate, hiding the 8.5% masterfully. Good stuff!
Copper colour with a frothy white head. Very strong fruit aroma with background of yeast. refreshing flavour and texture. Yeast, malt. Bitter tangy spice finish. Astringent cider notes.
Pours hazel nut brown with a white head. Aroma is sweet and sour very nice aroma. Tastes great. Smooth and delicate with a very nice finish dry and lingering. Dupont does it again. Perfect.

Bottle; thanks to Glouglouburp. Thanks Dany!!! Pours cloudy tawny-gold, 1-finger off-white head, spotty lacing. Nose is brandyish, with clean grain, rye, obvious Dupont yeast, green apple, tart raisin, and leather. Flavours are tart and medium to lighter-bodied; flavours of apple, leather, cider, white wine (Muscadet?) and cedar/oak. Very leathery and cedary finish. Extremely pleasant brew.

Orange with lasting flat head.  Spicy citrus and grassy bready herbal aroma with a touch of toffee.  Orangey sweet with a touch of toasted caramel tobacco and bitter orange peel finish.  For a biere de garde, not bad.  For a Dupont, fuggetaboutit.  Im not sure what they can do.  Does anyone even like bieres de garde?  They already have the best saison, the best seasonal strong saison, one of the best golden strongs and strong brunes.  Maybe they should have gone quad instead.
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Bready malty aroma with spicy yeasty notes. The flavor has spicy yeast, and bready and sweet malts. Pretty good.
Bottle shared by GT2.  Thanks.  Very dry, grassy and slightly herbal hops.  Not much malt character like you usually see in the style.  Lightly fruity, grassy, peppery, estery flavor.  Tasty.
On tap at Beer Revolution. Pours dark copper with a nice off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a fruity caramel malt flavor with a sweet jasmine finish. Very interesting and tasty.
Slightly skunked nose with lots of herbs and cotton candy. The taste is very dry and moderately bitter,  lots of golden fruits, herbal and grassy hops with peppery yeast.

750mL c&c. Pours a hazy dirty peach. Medium off white head with decent swathes of lace. Nose is almost identical to Saison Dupont- 100% house yeast with mild skunked citrus hops from the green glass. Ugh. Perhaps excessive yellow apples. Stinging nose with sharp lemon, mild butterscotch and sticky candies. Taste is malty, smooth caramel body, decent carbonation balancing but ending with some metals and excessive dryness for style. Tastes so incredibly similar to Saison Dupont its hard to recognize this as the Biere de Garde version and more like just a clone with a smithering of specialty malt for color. Sparkling carbonation with some excessive blandness. Probably fermentation to too low of a final gravity. No breadiness or Biere de Garde character.

Bottle shared by GT2.  Pours lightly hazy amber with an average, creamy white head, long retention with light lacing.  Aroma is biscuit and cookie malt, light spicy and earthy hops, and light fruity esters.  Flavor is dominant malt with background hops and bitterness, fruity esters, and farmhouse yeast.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation.

On draft at Beer Revolution courtesy of Marcus. It pours burnt orange with a very tall off white head. The aroma is full of fruit, mostly banana and peach with some nice floral and minty notes for balance. The flavor has some spicy clove and fruit basket. The alcohol is noticeable with a big body, but not too sweet as some are of this style. It has a somewhat toasty finish.
Draft at rattle. Pours a bright orange with no head. Aroma is plain sweet fruit. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of fruit, funk, sweet malt. A bit plain, but solid.

750 ml bottle at RBNAG-11. Hazy orange body with a thin tan head. Aroma is mild malty, fruity and some spices. Flavor is refreshing fruity, bitter oranges, light malt, hint of honey and moderate bitterness. Medium body, some complexity of subtle flavors.

Flaske: Orangebrun øl med en del gærresiduer. Ordentligt hældt en fantastisk flot øl med et stort lækkert skumhoved. Duften er maltet, og minder tydeligt mere om en biere de garde end en saison, desværre. Selvom det er en rigtig god øl der også smager dejligt, når den ikke Dupont saisons højder. Fin.

Bottle 750ml @ RBNAG-11
Pours cloudy orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt and licorice. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottled. Malt and vinegar aroma. Rather sweet, complex. Fine barnyard funkiness.

Shared bottle at the RBNAG-11 grand tasting. Hazy golden with a white rim. Band aid, malts and honey on the nose. Sweet and light acidic flavors with notes of spices and grains. Full body. Alco warmth. Grows in the mouth.

0.75l bottle @ RBNAG11. Pours a clouded copper-orange body with a small filmy sidesticking head. Aroma has yeasty fruit-hints, some pears, apples, apricot and nuts. Average carbonation with a oily mouthfeel. Flavors are also fruity, strange mustard seeds-tones, some apples and nuts before I get some yeasty hints in the somewhat dry finish. Nice stuff!

Bottle thanks to Dany. Appearance: Dark gold with creamy white head. Aroma: Matly, light yeast and lemon. Some Dupont light and enjoyable funk. Taste: Nice mix from the malts and yeast along with a thirst quenching acidity. Very refreshing. Palate: Full bodied and lively carbonation. Overall: Very good as expected with Dupont.

Shared bottle, RBNAG 2011. Deep golden to amber colour. Main impression of both aroma and flavour is "moderate everything" - but this would probably stand out as a decent saison if sampled on its own, and not in immediate connection with many sours. Decent hops in the finish.

750 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a hazy amber colour with good-sized lasting cream-coloured head.  Aroma is very Belgian yeasty - sweet/sour light fruits, spice and a bit of caramel.  Flavour is dominated by fruit notes - grapes, apples and pears sort of sweet, sort of musty, and a distinct spicy note.  Finishes somewhat dry and musty.  A nice one.

 Editorial note: Phenolic  Phenols can come from either yeast fermentation or bacterial infection. The phenols from fermentation are usually acceptable but common only in German-style wheat beers (clove, vanilla, light smoke). Phenols from infection are nasty  medicine, paint thinner, Band-Aids, bleach. Very rarely, medicinal qualities are sought by the brewer (Orval and a handful of other specialty Belgian ales) but the other bacterial phenols are always a sign of an infection.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2010 In short: A splendid farmhouse Biere de Garde with a Saison character.  Kick-ass.
How: Bottle 750ml, consumed relatively fresh (almost 2 years before best-before date) 
The look: Cloudy dirty golden body topped by a medium off-white head.
In long: Nose is really farmhouse, somewhere between a french Biere de Garde and a Dupont Saison (Moinette Biologique).  Body could hardly be more satisfying, a ton of cereals, a whole lot of yeast, very chewy and fluffy.  The Dupont signature yeast is all over the place and the beer is as much a Saison as it is a Biere de Garde if not more.  A lot of cobweb.  A lot of floral hops that feels like a garden flowers petals mash.  More cobweb.  The juicy garden flower petals is followed by a nice dryness in the finish.  No alcohol presence at all.  Dupont, a name that inspire all the respect and admiration that a name like Bush does not.

Any first impressions?
-A veil of foam sits atop the cloudy orange-amber.
-Cork has seeped into the nose, and takes a while before its evaporates completely.
-Peach and apricot jam lead to honey sweetness, trickling onto dry earth.
-The fluffy, soft effervescence is fitting but the flavor profile is somewhat overwhelmed.

What if you dig deeper?
-Once the cork emanations have mostly disappeared, vague fruity yeast esters show, as does nascent oxidation.
-A dry finish heralds earthiness, and tired grassy hoppiness.
-There is a touch of wilderness within.
-Obviously, our bottle hasnt evolved too well, and the cork might have been the main culprit here. A shame really, since the beer underneath must have been really interesting without these problems.
